heading-order:
HTML heading tags (h1 through h6) should be used in a sequentially-descending order to create a clear hierarchy of content and improve accessibility for screen reader users. This means that an h1 tag should be followed by an h2 tag, an h2 tag by an h3 tag, and so on. Here's an example of how to use heading tags in a sequentially-descending order: ```html Sequentially-descending headings example

Main heading (h1)

Subheading (h2)

Some content related to the subheading.

Sub-subheading (h3)

Some content related to the sub-subheading.

Another level down (h4)

Some content related to this h4 heading.

Almost at the smallest level (h5)

Some content related to this h5 heading.

Smallest heading (h6)

Some content related to this h6 heading.

``` In this example, the headings are used in a sequentially-descending order, starting from the main heading (h1) down to the smallest heading (h6). This structure helps screen reader users understand the hierarchy of the content and navigate it more easily.
